Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: w00dward
Reviews.Content: About 100 yard's from Rome termini station,no taxi's to pay for.Young staff very friendly and helpful.Single room a bit small but for the price you can't complain.You don't spend your time in your room in Rome anyway.Only stayed for 2 nights but room was still cleaned on second day.Great budget hotel,I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay.!!”
Reviews.Author: Nirmal4nov
Reviews.Content: We had to take it from the last minitue booking service from the railway station because the ones we had booked couldnt be taken. The hotel is almost alongside the central station.The location is the a great advantage. The room was very small. Were not very pleased with the receptionist too. Wi-fi is available on extra payment. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location for the budget conscious.”
Reviews.Author: denver60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel (pensione) Marsala for 10 days on this trip as we really wanted to explore Rome. First, let me say that we are very budget conscious travelers (in our late 50's to early 70's) and like to see and do as much as possible (we don't spend much time in our room...we are too busy nosing about) without breaking the bank in doiing so. With that said, we were pleasantly surprised by our room at the Marsala. The location is just great...a perfect base for sightseeing (trains, buses and metro all depart from Termini). The hotel is, literally, across the street from Termini station (take the Marsala exit from the station). Our room was on the top floor (I think there were only 2 on this floor) ...ask for a room on the top floor if possible, had a nice little balcony overlooking via Marsala, tv, fridge, safe and bathroom. Breakfast was included and was fine...no gourmet experience, but just fine for us. We dined at various venues for lunch and dinner. There is also a laundry nearby if needed. The desk staff was pleasant and our room was cleaned daily with fresh towels. We arrived in Rome at about 8pm (tired), took the express train from Fiumicino airport and walked to our hotel from the station. Simple!! On our previous trip to Rome, we stayed at a 4 star hotel. The room was NOT much better than our room at the 2 star Marsala, but the cost was much higher and the location not nearly as convenient. Beds were hard at both 4 star and 2 star hotels. However, we were so exhausted after a full day of activitiy we had little problems getting to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value beside train station”
Reviews.Author: baxter1
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star property, but for the money you pay it is great value. Smashing location, right next to train station. Shared bathrooms are a disadvantage, but I found them to be always clean. Rooms are small but have all facilities as advertised. Didn't partake of breakfast any morning so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “In the U.S. this place would be lucky to get 1 star.”
Reviews.Author: travcat235
Reviews.Content: After other plans fell through I booked this hotel based on location and price. The location was convenient. The price was not worth it. For American travelers, this hotel is not for the faint of heart. It doesn't scream safe (although it probably was fine), the power kept going out (we wondered if they just didn't pay the power bill or what), the shared bathroom was not close to our room, and was dirty and scary feeling. The lights were fluorescent tubes and beds felt like sleeping on plywood or cardboard....good thing we were exhausted otherwise I would not have slept at all. I don't think this place would even pass for a college dorm in the 1970s. Sad, because that hotel has a lot of potential. Unfortunately I have to say it was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: SwissWahine
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome without accomodation as our plans had fallen through. The train station hotel booking desk suggested this place. It was a mistake. The first problem was that when we turned up the room wasn't ready and we had to wait one hour. The room was cheap, 60€ per night but then there was the hotel tax, an extra 2€ each and the luggage room was an extra 2€ per bag if you wanted to leave them past the check out time. The sheets on the bed were clean but the ensuite bathroom was filthy. As other TA reveiwers have said the service is non-existant and because its one a main street its very noisy at night. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “from good to ghastly”
Reviews.Author: nellalucedelsole
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this place a couple times over the years when couldn't find anything else. Lik ea lot of hotels n role they have some very good rooms fo rhte prive (the ones the show on the photos) and some real cupboards you can barely get a suitcase into. Bizzarely, the first time I stayed here with my sister we got an excellent room and were happy with it, so the next time we returned to Rome we booked again, and got a disgusting dirty little hole. If you have to stay here try and get the room booked at Termini station at the Hotel counter, they will get you a far cheaper price than if you walk in off the street. Still, ask the guy at the hotel desk to find you something else if possible. The staff here are unpleasant. But it is right next to the station so if you come in late I guess you could stay here for a night. But no longer unless really necessary!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location.. bathroom not so good”
Reviews.Author: hols-in-italy
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised to first see the room - it was an ok size, had a sink, TV, fridge, wardrobe space and space underneath the bed which was good for putting suitcases and bags out of the way. It's in an ok location - close to Termini, but still could walk to most places within 30-40 mins. Metro and buses at Termini if you don't like to walk and want to avoid being knocked down by scooters. Staff was very friendly and pleasant. Breakfast was included and it was good; coffees (from machine), juices, fruit, cheeses, prosciutto, croissants, bread, marmalade, jams etc. We had towels provided and bed linen was changed on the 3rd day. The negatives: bathroom was not clean.. toilet frequently dirty.. so were shower and sink, other people's towels were left on the floor on a few occasions. Also, the air con is just a noisy ceiling fan and for any air, you need to leave the window open. Our room was tucked away at the back so didn't let in much noise. Not sure if this is a problem in all rooms, but the overhead light was so ridiculously bright, it hurt my eyes! there was no lampshade, just a glaring white harsh light. I'd stay there again but would prob bring my own lampshade. and maybe get an ensuite room.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect anything”
Reviews.Author: charms2
Reviews.Content: besides the location there is nothing about this place that would entice you to visit it again. room extremely small, curtains not hanged properly, no attention to anything.

Reviews.Title: “horrible expireance!!!!”
Reviews.Author: urin90
Reviews.Content: rome is a very high tempured city, manly during the high season (june,july,augost ext), and the thing you need the most after a long day of walking and waiting those long long museom lines is a nice clean coasy and ambracing hotel to rest your feet there. hotel marsala is exectlly the very opposite to this discreption!!! when you walk up the stairs to the reception you will surley never get a smile of hello from the very un-plessent guy in there and when the water in your pre-payd private shover will run out, the only answer you will get from the same recption guy is:"what do you wany me to do?i didn't broke the water pipe"...i mean c'mon, have some desency to send me get a shower somewhere. long story short-service is very bad.breakfast as well(pure and cheap,if you arrive in 09:15, 45 minutes before the breakfest endes, the staff will not fill up bread,juice,jams,butter and ext). to be fair i've got to state that the room was a good well aquipped room and the location was very well.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T SPOIL YOUR HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: PANKAJNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel in mid May'11 for one night and its a horrible experience staying in this hotel. The front desk staff specially name called "Ni" have no attiquetes to deal with the guests. The hotel is totally bad in all amentities from bed, toilets, wash basin, breakfast etc. kindly do not visit this hotel on any kind of visit. Every minutes of my stay the room was full of noise of ongoing traffic down the street. Not at all good for stay..

Reviews.Title: “stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Opinionated35
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about this hotel is closeness to the Termini train station. However, the area is not safe at night, so be careful. The rooms were large but did not look anything like the picture. The furniture was old and looked strange. The sheets were clean. The hotel's bathrooms were not located in the room, for the most part. There were 2 community bathrooms on the floors and they were not usable. On two floors one of the two toilets was broken or clogged. The staff was not respectful and was clearly unsupportive. When I asked for a manager, first the young girl at the reception told me she'd give me the number. But then she said that she did not have a manager and that there were no superiors, and that the hotel belonged to "church." I asked, "what church?" and she said, "We have only one church." I was unable to contact anyone to get the toilets cleaned. The room walls were so thin that when I spoke with the regular voice, the people asked me to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “It was cheap”
Reviews.Author: debbiejaffajaf
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting a lot from this place as I hadn't paid a lot and it was right next to Termini train station. The man on the desk spoke good English, so that was a nice welcome. The rooms were very small and simple - I thought of nunneries actually. But I managed to sleep on the wire frame bed. Luckily I had packed my travel pillow and used that rather than the pillow supplied that was rather flat. The bed was clean though. I couldn't get the fan, nor the fridge to work no matter how I tried and having the window open meant trying to sleep through some of the worst traffic noise I had ever heard - again, thank goodness I'd thought to pack earplugs. I knew the bathroom was shared and didn't have any problem with that - it appeared clean and other guests were courteous. Breakfast was wonderful, and staff were very friendly. This is a cheap hotel this is close to Rome - don't expect the Hilton, but it was safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located and clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marganne
Reviews.Content: For € 154 for three nights through booking.com we got a nice room with bathroom,balcony and airconditioing on the top floor. The room was spacious and clean, with a safe,tv and refrigerator. The bathroom was also spotless and very complete (with even a bidet) . Soap and some shampoopackages were provided. The airconditionig kept the room cool and hardly made any noise. Towels were changed daily. The top floor o/nly has a view rooms which are away from the busy street, so it was very quiet at night. Breakfast was just fine,with good coffee, cornflakes and milk, bread,cheese,ham and sweet rolls/croissants. And ofcourse the location next to Termini station, sightseeing tourbuses and metro is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this rat hole manned by a crooked Chinese fellow”
Reviews.Author: meglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I warn you guys, never ever go to this place - This is a smelling rat hole.The rooms can be best described as good for cattle or birds.Broken floor tiles, dingy toilets, toilette sized rooms, broken/clogged taps - It is hell To add to the woes, there is one crooked chinese fellow manning the hotel .I dont know whether the Roma authorities are aware of such a thing going on in the centre of Rome, very close to the Termini station. This hotel is a shame to Rome

Reviews.Title: “My friend considered taking one for the team and hooking up to stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: RachaelRae
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on the cheap price of 52 euros a night and the fact that it is located across the street from Roma Termini. These were the only pros and frankly, we overpaid. The double bed was infested with bugs. We woke up covered in bite marks. The ceiling fan was apparently just for show because it didn't work. We had to sleep on the floor in our underwear and preferred using dirty clothes instead of an actual pillow just to stay cool. The safe box had the combination written on the front. The refridgerator didn't really work and had a key, so we threw our stuff in that. You share one toilet and one shower with the entire floor and they didn't even clean it. We were lulled to sleep with the sounds of breaking bottles, screaming people, and the beeps of cars in an everlasting traffic jam due to a constant yellow light. The receptionists require you turn in your key when you leave the building because they are "afraid you may lose it". The first time we turned it in and when we came back they didn't do ANY security checks to make sure we paid for the room. So after that we refused to hand them the key. Overall. It was gross. 52 euros is never worth this.

Reviews.Title: “This cannot be called a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZghicheS
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed in this hotel for two nights, and we would not advise it, as you are supposed to walk all day long in Rome to visit the city, you need a comfortable hotel room to rest, hotel Marsal has nothing to help you with that.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the streets of Rome, but not in this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anurag_poddar
Reviews.Content: We reached Rome on 17th July 2009. The only thing good about this Hotel is that it is a stone's throw away from from the Roma Termini! Waiting at a cheap excuse for a "reception desk" was still tolerbale ...but finally the manager there asked us to be seated in an adjoining room & only because he was incompetent & inadquately staffed to manage the check-ins happening that day. A one-hour wait to check-in could still be pardoned until what we were offered was a room which was on the top-floor of the building & was even hotter than a furnace. The heat from the sun on the Roman streets was a pleasant & thankful respite from the room! The "AC room" (with no fan) which we got had just the AC vent...and all that came out of it was a noise which sounded like that of a car with a damaged silencer. Finally, at about midnight, we had to settle for a room (on the second floor) which did'nt have an AC but had a fan. God knows what we did to deserve this or where we went wrong while selecting our Hotel! All-in-all, in the 6 hotels we stayed during our visit to 6 cities in Europe (Italy, Paris, Switzerland), this was the the only one which was HORRIBLE. Thank God for my love for the Ancient city of Rome, that I did'nt create a fuss!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and at the Marsala usually less”
Reviews.Author: CalOzz
Reviews.Content: The room had no A/C,just a very noisy fan on the ceiling. The bathrooms were down the hall,and usually with wet floors and no paper towels. We ordered internet services which were suppose to be for 24 hours,when we couldn't get it to work I went down to the front desk,where I was told to call a number which he provided. He advised to call from the room. Later we discovered that we were charged $25+ for the call! When we complained,we were told that we made the call so the charges were expected to be paid. When the tv quit working,it took 3 different times of notifying the front desk before someone came up and got it working. The room was very noisy and hot. The beds were hard,and almost no amenities. Breakfast consisted of eggs,ham and cereal.along with some baked breads etc.. Although breakfast ends at 11, usually by 9 the eggs ran out and they would not make anymore. The room did have a little refrigerator,although it didn't work. I guess none of them worked since they allow you to put some items in their frig. near the front desk. We did that and someone took our soft drinks from the frig. So,if you just need a noisy place to crash,then I guess it will do. What I found unacceptable was the attitude of some of the staff,they treat you like you should be happy and not complaining about the various shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean; for the modest traveler”
Reviews.Author: ajg114
Reviews.Content: Hotel Marsala is a pensione (budget hotel) that my husband and I found when we came back to Rome from Venice for one final night's stay before leaving for the airport the next day. It's less than a 5 minute walk from/to the train & subway station (which was perfect for us). We had a very pleasant experience here. Our room was very modest looking, yet very clean. The bathroom was very clean and had a shower (no tub). We stayed in a room that didn't have a great view, but that's not what we were looking to get anyway since we were planning to spend the rest of the day roaming around the city. When you get to your room, you will have to use the key card that should be provided with your key. Place your key card in the slot near the door and this will activate the electricity and air conditioning in the room. The room didn't get super cold like the previous two hotels we stayed in, but it was good enough for me. The room was very spacious. The room comes with an LCD television which also functions as a computer screen if you decide to access the internet. The internet is 7 euros to use for the entire day. We would stay here again, for a short-term stay. This is a 2-star hotel. If you are looking for a nice honeymoon or romantic spot, then look elsewhere; however, if you are looking for no-frills and something very simple yet clean, this would be a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: jbehrendsen
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were put in a room with no air conditioning which was our one stipulation when booking, and we were told we would. The bathroom was also disgusting and moldy. But after extensive complaining we were actually moved to what seemed to be a secret room off the lobby that had a brand new bathroom and air conditioning. The only downside was they wouldn't hesitate to make a lot of noise outside of our room, even if we were sleeping. The internet went out the first day we were there but we were told there was nothing that could be done... even though we had already paid for it. Staff was adequately friendly, helpful if needed. There was a strange old man that sat in the lobby every night. I think he was perhaps the father of the man at the front desk. But he would always turn the TV up loud and not bother to turn it down even when asked nicely. It is very close to the metro and termini which was AWESOME. Fairly close to other things as well. Continental breakfast was average. Eggs, biscuits, and some sort of small hot dogs. Great coffee though. Probably wouldn't go back, but didn't altogether hate it. Would recommend to friends doing serious traveling and only need a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Direction of Hotel Marsala from Station”
Reviews.Author: Dr_B_Maitra
Reviews.Content: Dr. Bhaskar Maitra, Kolkata, India Direction of the Hotel from the Train Station: When you alight from your train in the Stazione Termini in Rome, walk straight up the platform without taking any diversions. You will reach the end of the platform. Turn right and come out of the station. Cross the street in front of you and turn left and walk along the pavement. The third building on that pavement is Hotel Marsala. Don't be enticed by the taxis that will offer you to take you to this hotel for which they charge anything between 20-30 Euros. It will hardly take 3-4 mins. of walking from the station. Rooms are clean and linen is changed daily but you will not like the general outlook of the rooms. They are shabby. Furthermore the hotel has got only three rooms with attached bathrooms, the rest are without. Breakfast is considerably good compared to breakfast in other properties of the same rent in European countries. In this regard the hotels in Asian countries are far superior and their breakfast spreads are overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Bleeker151
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect as some of the reviews were a little dodgy but I was pleasently surprised. From the outside it does not look great but once you're inside it's grand. It's cheap and it's right beside the main train station which was perfect for an early morning train. The rooms were quite big and spotless, but the beds were'nt great. Very soft. But overall I would recomend this hotel for a shotr stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: meinir
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be excellent value for money in Rome. Rooms clean and comfortable. Breakfast typical continental but good. Staff not over friendly but alway polite and willing to help if you ask. We had problems with our shower one night and they offered to move us to another room we decided to stay were put and the shower was fixed first thing next morning. Location is great as it is just across the street to where the buses from the airport drop off and right by the main railway station and underground. People do say not to stay in this area around the train station but this is the 4th time we have stayed in this area and we have never had any trouble. You do see tramps in the doorways etc but if you ignore them they are no trouble. Also food and drink in this area is cheaper than other areas of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: PR_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We did not have big expectations for our hotels in Europe but we were pleasently surprised by this one. The room was spacious and had its own (clean) bathroom. It is very near the train station and the area where the tour buses pick up/drop off. Breakfast was included (coffee and bread). Be careful, we were pick pocketted by a group of women (during the day). I would not suggest going out much at night in the area.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Marsala
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marsala, 36, 00185 Rome, Italy
